caption:
The photograph depicts a vibrant and colorful scene from a parade or public celebration. In the foreground, three African American women are seated in a convertible car adorned with flowers. The woman in the center is smiling broadly at the camera and wearing a striking pink dress with ruffled sleeves and a corsage, complemented by a rainbow-colored afro wig. The two other women, one on her right and one on her left, also sport colorful afro wigs in yellow and purple, and are dressed in stylish, period-specific outfits.

The background of the image is slightly out of focus but reveals a crowd of spectators lining the road, suggesting the event is well-attended and possibly takes place in a park-like setting with ample trees. The atmosphere is festive and lively, reflective of a joyous communal celebration or parade. The image captures a moment of joy and exuberance, typical of cultural or historical parades from the era, likely in the 1960s or 1970s given the fashion and style depicted.
title: Black beauties with colorful hair grace a float during the annual Bud Billiken Day Parade along Dr. Martin L. King Jr. Drive on Chicago's South Side. Up to half a million people view one of the largest events of the year, held for Blacks of all ages and economic status. The parade also includes Black politicians, Black businesses displaying their products, and Black bands.
